definition: to have a voracious desire for/to covet/greedy/corrupt
to defeat/to damage/to lose (to an opponent)/to fail/to wither

sentences.english: Work harder to build an honest government, punish graft and corruption
sentences.chinese: 加強廉政建設，懲治貪污腐敗。

sentences.english: However, no matter how he avoid, he cannot shirk the responsibility of the country's prolonged poverty and corruption problem.
sentences.chinese: 他無論如何卸責，也不可能忽視自己國家的貪污腐敗。

sentences.english: And then the city boss appears, municipal corruption became a popular thing in American.
sentences.chinese: 於是，城市老闆霸佔市廳數十年，貪污腐敗盛行一時。

sentences.english: China’s rulers say corrupt cadres are the nation’s worst enemy.
sentences.chinese: 中國當政者說，官員貪污腐敗是國家最大的毒瘤。

sentences.english: Most of the people who were his targets were gangsters or corrupt politicians.
sentences.chinese: 而他的目標大多是流氓匪徒或貪污腐敗的政客。

definition: to break the law and violate discipline (idiom)
(of an official) corrupt and negligent of his duty
lit. a horse that brings trouble to its herd (idiom)/fig. troublemaker/black sheep/rotten apple
to gang up for personal interest (idiom)/to form a clique
to assess one's income and spend accordingly (idiom); to live within one's means/You can only spend what you earn.
to criticize (as a matter of principle)
